Lynn.John Tucker Daland House:
The John Tucker Daland House (1851–1852) is an imposing, Italianate house designed by architect Gridley James Fox Bryant and is located at 132 Essex Street, Salem, Massachusetts, United States in the Essex Institute Historic District and now owned by the Peabody Essex Museum as home for the Essex Institute. It is open to the public six days a week.
The three-story brick house was originally built for John Tucker Daland, a prosperous merchant.
